channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Huge plant pots on carriageway., 1st February
item.description:
You pro forma list of issues isn't specific enough to accurately identify the issue-I have chosen the nearest description I could find. There is a row of large plant pots on the carriageway outside the properties Water Hatch House and Hillview. These obstruct the already narrow road at a 90° bend. Please arrange their removal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Silk Mill Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Is 24 Shelley Road, Cheltenham, Gl51 7DR. I’m sorry I didn’t add it to the most recent email, as it was on the previous complaint I had sent. I assumed someone may have connected the two. This most resent hole, has now developed large pieces of stones, that are being catapulted into the road and onto the pavement. If one hits someone, it could be potentially serious. My son in law picked some up yesterday, as one clipped their car, luckily no damage, as he was slowing down, not speeding as some do. I have already reported this, but I couldn’t add my address to original post, Kind regards Margaret Finch, 1st February
item.description:
Good afternoon, My address is 24 Shelley Road, Cheltenham, Gl51 7DR. I’m sorry I didn’t add it to the most recent email, as it was on the previous complaint I had sent. I assumed someone may have connected the two. This most resent hole, has now developed large pieces of stones, that are being catapulted into the road and onto the pavement. If one hits someone, it could be potentially serious. My son in law picked some up yesterday, as one clipped their car, luckily no damage, as he was slowing down, not speeding as some do. Kind regards Margaret Finch

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Wasley Road, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: You cleared two drains previously but did not rod or hose it thru as blocked in the pipe . It blocks , overflows and rain water rubs down washing the mud down to the bridge where it floods and now looks awful with a mud bath, 1st February
item.description:
As you come off the main ciren road north park farm is on the left . As you pass the first sharp bend the ka drain is positioned 109 foot down on the right by the railings .. there is also one opposite .. unless these are hosed thru they Bloch up in a day as last time .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold

item.title: Multiple potholes on Sandyleaze Road, 1st February
item.description:
Multiple potholes in the Sandyleaze and surrounding roads leading onto Nine Elms Road very large potholes. A cyclist riding in the dark could get seriously injured, also when driving and potholes are filled with rain water not realising how deep the potholes are would damage a car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandyleaze, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several large pot holes on left hand side driving from Down Hatherley lane to innsworth lane, 31st January
item.description:
Too many potholes to list individually, the left side of the road is gradually being warn away The majority of frog furling lane is affected going towards innsworth lane. This is a health and safety issue as cars trying to miss potholes are further into the path of oncoming traffic
